posts.post_content: i really wish i could just ask wizards **why** sometimes, because this card is completely over-costed and literally just doesnt make sense to print. [Demolish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demolish) is pretty much the same card printed in m11 and it costs one less. Unfortunatley all i can say is, i just wish this card was good, i wish it cost less, I mean if this was still the same cost as [Demolish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demolish)i'm sure people would still complain about it, but to add more to it's CMC? Just doesn't make any sense. If Wizards doesn't want to print any effectively costed Land Destruction cards then why even bother printing land destruction ever, especially if we're going to get cards like this? :/ 0.5/5

posts.post_content: Cards like this make me suspicious of the whole idea of an artifact block, because this would only ever be used as long as Mirrodin is still in rotation. I really hate cards that obsolete themselves. This whole set feels gimmicky, like the frost mechanic from Cold Snap. If Wizards is really that bereft of ideas that they have to revisit old sets, why not fun ones like Ravinca or Shadowmoor? I know it hasn't been that long, but Alara never got its *enemy* shards...
posts.html:
Cards like this make me suspicious of the whole idea of an artifact block, because this would only ever be used as long as Mirrodin is still in rotation. I really hate cards that obsolete themselves. This whole set feels gimmicky, like the frost mechanic from Cold Snap. If Wizards is really that bereft of ideas that they have to revisit old sets, why not fun ones like Ravinca or Shadowmoor? I know it hasn't been that long, but Alara never got its enemy shards...
